question_text: How does the data transmission method of SAS improve upon older parallel SCSI?
answer_options: By reducing the number of physical drives needed
By transmitting multiple bits in parallel to increase speed
By using serial signaling, reducing interference and improving speed
By allowing wireless data access between devices
correct_answer: By using serial signaling, reducing interference and improving speed
explanation: SAS uses serial communication instead of parallel, which reduces crosstalk and supports higher speeds and longer cable runs.
